snippet: Universal’s “Fast & Furious” series is a second-class citizen in Hollywood, but not online, where it has more Facebook “likes” than any active film series except “Avatar.”
abstract: Universal's $1.8 billion car-racing franchise Fast & Furious has nearly unmatched social networking support, with over 24.9 million Facebook 'likes'; latest installment, Fast & Furious 6, garnered a larger online response than several higher-budget films that were advertised during the Super Bowl.
lead_paragraph: Universal’s “Fast & Furious” series is a second-class citizen in Hollywood, but not online, where it has more Facebook “likes” than any active film series except “Avatar.”

headline.seo: ‘Fast & Furious 6’ Focuses on Its Online Following for Promotion
headline.main: ‘Fast & Furious’ Stresses Social Side of Fandom
headline.print_headline: ‘Fast & Furious’ Stresses Social Side of Fandom
